import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.e5b4ff29:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
source.b24234b2:
!pip install openpyxl
medals = pd.read_excel('../input/2021-olympics-in-tokyo/Medals.xlsx', engine='openpyxl')
gender = pd.read_excel('../input/2021-olympics-in-tokyo/EntriesGender.xlsx', engine='openpyxl')
athletes = pd.read_excel('../input/2021-olympics-in-tokyo/Athletes.xlsx', engine='openpyxl')
teams = pd.read_excel('../input/2021-olympics-in-tokyo/Teams.xlsx', engine='openpyxl')
coaches = pd.read_excel('../input/2021-olympics-in-tokyo/Coaches.xlsx', engine='openpyxl')
source.09828f71:
fig = px.bar(top_10, x='Team/NOC', y='Total', title='Top 10 Countries in Overall Medal Count')
fig.show()
source.cad91862:
top_10_gold = medals[['Team/NOC', 'Gold']][0:10]
top_10_gold = top_10_gold.sort_values('Gold', ascending=False)
fig = px.bar(top_10_gold, x='Team/NOC',y='Gold', title='Race for Gold Medals: Top 10 Countries')
fig.show()
source.43cd1d3f:
medals_usa = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'United States of America']
medals_chi = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == "People's Republic of China"]
medals_jpn = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'Japan']
medals_gb = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'Great Britain']
medals_roc = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'ROC']
medals_aus = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'Australia']
medals_ned = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'Netherlands']
medals_fra = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'France']
medals_ger = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'Germany']
medals_ita = medals[medals['Team/NOC'] == 'Italy']
source.d724a9d1:
fig=go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_usa['Team/NOC'],y=medals_usa['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold'))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_usa['Team/NOC'],y=medals_usa['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver'))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_usa['Team/NOC'],y=medals_usa['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze'))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_chi['Team/NOC'],y=medals_chi['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_chi['Team/NOC'],y=medals_chi['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_chi['Team/NOC'],y=medals_chi['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_jpn['Team/NOC'],y=medals_jpn['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_jpn['Team/NOC'],y=medals_jpn['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_jpn['Team/NOC'],y=medals_jpn['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_gb['Team/NOC'],y=medals_gb['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_gb['Team/NOC'],y=medals_gb['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_gb['Team/NOC'],y=medals_gb['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_roc['Team/NOC'],y=medals_roc['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_roc['Team/NOC'],y=medals_roc['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_roc['Team/NOC'],y=medals_roc['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_aus['Team/NOC'],y=medals_aus['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_aus['Team/NOC'],y=medals_aus['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_aus['Team/NOC'],y=medals_aus['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ned['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ned['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ned['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ned['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ned['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ned['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_fra['Team/NOC'],y=medals_fra['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_fra['Team/NOC'],y=medals_fra['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_fra['Team/NOC'],y=medals_fra['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ger['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ger['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ger['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ger['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ger['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ger['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ita['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ita['Gold'], marker_color='gold', name='Gold', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ita['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ita['Silver'], marker_color='silver', name='Silver', showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=medals_ita['Team/NOC'],y=medals_ita['Bronze'], marker_color='brown', name='Bronze', showlegend=False))

fig.update_layout(barmode='stack', title='Distribution of Medals in Top 10 Countries')
fig.show()

source.af068934:

source.c8f5aed7:
females = gender['Female'].sum()
males = gender['Male'].sum()
values=[females,males]
labels=['Female', 'Male']
fig = go.Figure(data = go.Pie(values=values, labels=labels))
fig.update_layout(title='Participation of Male and Female Athletes')
fig.show()
